title: Mongo DB subdocuments and associations
description: Added subdocument PostSchema to the User Model.  Tested adding and removing subdocuments to and fron existing records.  Added a virtual type to take the place of the incrementally defined postCount. Created associations using Refs.
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, subdocument, virtual type associations

title: Mongo DB subdocuments and associations
description: Added subdocument PostSchema to the User Model.  Tested adding and removing subdocuments to and fron existing records.  Added a virtual type to take the place of the incrementally defined postCount. Created associations using Refs.
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, subdocument, virtual type associations

title: Mongo DB queries and operators
description: Went through the many different queries you can use to achieve full CRUD in MongoDB and Mongoose. Used the increment update operator.  Also inplemented basic validation requiring a name and the name length to be more than 2 characters.
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, validation, operators, queries

title: Slowly moving through Mongo DB
description: Built a lot of mocha tests today while following the class. Getting back to the basics of MongoDB and Mongoose. Broke out the old Robo3T app, made a Schema, did find and findOne queries.  It's been very good review so far

title: The Complete Developers Guide to MongoDB
description: Started the Stephen Grider 13 hour MongoDB course on Udemy.  I think I could use some polishing on the back end.

title: Fixed bigfoot app and put it on portfolio.
description: The bigfoot app wasn't getting all the information from the bigfoot sightings API so I had to make another get request and then combine the arrays.  It was easier than I thought it would be.  I then added that project to this portfolio page.

title: Sorta finished the Bigfoot App
description: I worked on the bigfoot app today and added some ridiculous CSS and soundeffects for my own enjoyment.  It's close to done but I kind of wish i could have gotten the bigfoot pins to only appear on getting the users current position and I'd also like to have a search bar.  The api call isn't getting all the results so I have to figure out how to make subsequent fetches tomorrow. Wasn't as fun as I thought it would be :/
tools: react, api, css, javascript, animation, transitions, mapbox

title: Worked on the Bigfoot App
description: Worked all day long on the Bigfoot App. It was pretty frusterating because I couldn't get the state to keep up with the rendering from the API call.  I ended up just using a variable which i think is a no no but it sort of worked. Mapbox is pretty cool.  I would like it if bigfoot sighting pins would only load if they are within 10 miles of the user but that seems like a big battle.

title: Started working on the Bigfoot App
description: MEMORIAL DAY - I'm trying to get a users current position on a map that's proving to be more difficult then I thought iT would be because the async nature of getting a location

title: Added Filter Buttons to Portfolio
description: I added icon buttons to the top of the page that when clicked will filter the projects out that have that used that tool during developement.

title: Built Progress Log
description: This is my very first entry into the 'Progress Log' and the progress that I'm loggin is the 'Progress Log' itself. I fetched a local JSON with the information on it and looped over it to make this list (only 1 entry right now).  Then made it searchable by Title, Description or Tools. Had to change the function component into a class component which wasn't all that bad. I'll try and log things i've learned, tasks I've accomplished or failed here... Probably should make this log responsive ha ha. ðŸš€
tools: react, javascript, json, sticky, css, bootstrap, tables
